pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:0.2_0: The account of the nun Analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:0.5_0: The training rule on hitting one another
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.10_0: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.13_0: “... How could a nun do this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.14_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.15_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.16.1_0: ‘If a nun enters an inhabited area without wearing her chest wrap, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.2_0: a nun had entered a village for almsfood without wearing her chest wrap.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.3_0: While she was walking along a street, a whirlwind lifted up her upper robes.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.6_0: Because she was teased by those people, she felt humiliated.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.7_0: After returning to the nuns’ dwelling place, she told the nuns what had happened.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.8_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized Thullanandā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.9_0: “How could a nun enter an inhabited area without wearing her chest wrap?” ...
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.1.10_0: if she crosses the boundary of an enclosed inhabited area, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.1.11_0: If she enters the vicinity of an unenclosed inhabited area, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.1.4_0: ... The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.1.8_0: it is for the purpose of concealing the body below the collar bone and above the navel.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.10_0: The rule, the training rule on bartering, is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.11_0: The ninth sub-chapter on sunshades and sandals is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.14_0: “Venerables, the one hundred and sixty-six rules on confession have been recited.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.17_0: A second time I ask the Sangha to answer:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.21_0: This is the meaning of, I will remember it. I will remember it thus.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.23_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession in the nuns’ analysis is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.2_0: if her own robe has been stolen;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.7_0: They burn in times of trouble,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.9_0: if she is the first offender.
